IOT.IOTApplication.alarmclock

Class AlarmClockService

  • java.lang.Object
    • IOT.IOTApplication.alarmclock.AlarmClockService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOTApplicationInterface

    public class AlarmClockService
extends java.lang.Object
implements IOTApplicationInterface
    The AlarmClockService creates and saves alarms set by the user. A timer starts to run when the alarm is activated and a loud tune will be played at the corresponding time (through a Piezo element hooked to the Raspberry Pi). An alarm can only be added and started once and is not allowed to be set in the past. An error code will be returned if that happens.
    Version:
    Milestone2
    Author:
    Peter Klosowski (a1403029)

      • setAlarm

        public int setAlarm(java.util.Calendar date)
        Sets an Alarm if it doesn't exist yet.
        Parameters:
        date - Date that will be added to the alarms.
        Returns:
        -1 if alarm already exists, -4 if the date is in the past, else 0.

        Getter for a specific alarm.
        Parameters:
        date - Calendar date that will be searched if added
        Returns:
        Map of one date with date in miliseconds and if it has been started

      • startAlarm

        public int startAlarm(java.util.Calendar date)
        Starts a Timer thread that will be triggered at the time passed in the call.
        Parameters:
        date - time, at which alarm will sound
        Returns:
        -2 if the time wasn't added yet, -3 if the alarm was already started, -4 if passed date is in the past, else 0

      • cancelAlarm

        public int cancelAlarm(java.util.Calendar date)
        Cancel an already started alarm.
        Parameters:
        date - Time that will be canceled.
        Returns:
        -2 if the time wasn't added yet, -5 if it couldn't be cancelled, else 0

      • remAlarm

        public int remAlarm(java.util.Calendar date)
        Remove an alarm completely from the application.
        Parameters:
        date - Time that will be removed.
        Returns:
        -2 if the time wasn't added yet, -5 if it couldn't be cancelled, else 0
